metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9078 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Redirection from an HTTP connection to a "data:" URL assigns the referring site's origin to the "data:" URL in some circumstances. This can result in same-origin violations against a domain if it loads resources from malicious sites. Cross-origin setting of cookies has been demonstrated without the ability to read them. Note: This issue only affects Firefox 49 and 50. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
